Public MustInherit Class XmlReader Implements IDisposable
public ref class XmlReader abstract : IDisposable
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit XmlReader extends System.Object

summary.span: 表示提供对 XML 数据进行快速、非缓存、只进访问的读取器。

span.span: Represents a reader that provides fast, noncached, forward-only access to XML data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 提供对文档或流中的 XML 数据的只进只读访问。 provides forward-only, read-only access to XML data in a document or stream. 此类符合 W3C[可扩展标记语言（xml）1.0 （第四版）](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/)和[XML 1.0 （第三版）建议中的命名空间](https://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/)。This class conforms to the W3C [Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 (fourth edition)](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/) and the [Namespaces in XML 1.0 (third edition)](https://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/) recommendations. 利用 方法，你可以移动 XML 数据并读取节点的内容。 methods let you move through XML data and read the contents of a node. 类的属性反映当前节点（即读取器的位置）的值。The properties of the class reflect the value of the current node, which is where the reader is positioned. 属性值指示 XML 读取器的当前状态。The property value indicates the current state of the XML reader. 例如，属性设置为由 方法 ，并由 方法 。For example, the property is set to by the method and by the method. 还针对 DTD 或架构提供数据一致性检查和验证。 also provides data conformance checks and validation against a DTD or schema. 使用请求模型来检索数据。 uses a pull model to retrieve data. 此模型：This model: - 通过自然的自顶向下过程优化简化了状态管理。Simplifies state management by a natural, top-down procedural refinement. - 支持多个输入流和分层。Supports multiple input streams and layering. - 使客户端能够为分析器提供直接写入字符串的缓冲区，从而避免了额外的字符串复制。Enables the client to give the parser a buffer into which the string is directly written, and thus avoids the necessity of an extra string copy. - 支持选择性处理。Supports selective processing. 客户端可以跳过项，并处理应用程序感兴趣的项。The client can skip items and process those that are of interest to the application. 你还可以提前设置属性以管理 XML 流的处理方式（例如，规范化）。You can also set properties in advance to manage how the XML stream is processed (for example, normalization). 本节内容：In this section: [创建 XML 读取器](#xmlreader_create) [Creating an XML reader](#xmlreader_create) [验证 XML 数据](#xmlreader_validate) [Validating XML data](#xmlreader_validate) [数据一致性](#xmlreader_data) [Data conformance](#xmlreader_data) [在节点之间导航](#xmlreader_nodes) [Navigating through nodes](#xmlreader_nodes) [读取 XML 元素](#xmlreader_elements) [Reading XML elements](#xmlreader_elements) [读取 XML 特性](#xmlreader_attributes) [Reading XML attributes](#xmlreader_attributes) [读取 XML 内容](#xmlreader_content) [Reading XML content](#xmlreader_content) [转换为 CLR 类型](#xmlreader_clr) [Converting to CLR types](#xmlreader_clr) [异步编程](#xmlreader_async) [Asynchronous programming](#xmlreader_async) [安全注意事项Security considerations](#xmlreader_security) ## 创建 XML 读取器Creating an XML reader 使用 方法创建 实例。Use the method to create an instance. 尽管 .NET Framework 提供 类的具体实现，如 、和 类，但建议仅在以下情况下使用专用类：Although the .NET Framework provides concrete implementations of the class, such as the , , and the classes, we recommend that you use the specialized classes only in these scenarios: - 如果要从 对象读取 XML DOM 子树，请使用 类。When you want to read an XML DOM subtree from an object, use the class. （但是，此类不支持 DTD 或架构验证。）(However, this class doesn't support DTD or schema validation.) - 如果必须按请求展开实体，则不希望文本内容已规范化，或者不希望返回默认属性，请使用 类。If you must expand entities on request, you don't want your text content normalized, or you don't want default attributes returned, use the class. 若要指定要在 XML 读取器上启用的功能集，请将 对象传递到 方法。To specify the set of features you want to enable on the XML reader, pass an object to the method. 您可以使用单个 对象创建具有相同功能的多个读取器，或修改 对象以使用一组不同的功能创建新的读取器。You can use a single object to create multiple readers with the same functionality, or modify the object to create a new reader with a different set of features. 你还可以轻松地将功能添加到现有读取器。You can also easily add features to an existing reader. 如果不使用 对象，则使用默认设置。If you don't use a object, default settings are used. 请参阅 参考页获取详细信息。See the reference page for details. 引发 XML 分析错误的 。 throws an on XML parse errors. 引发异常后，读取器的状态不可预知。After an exception is thrown, the state of the reader is not predictable. 例如，报告的节点类型可能不同于当前节点的实际节点类型。For example, the reported node type may be different from the actual node type of the current node. 使用 属性检查读取器是否处于错误状态。Use the property to check whether the reader is in error state. ## 验证 XML 数据Validating XML data 若要定义 XML 文档及其元素关系、数据类型和内容约束的结构，请使用文档类型定义（DTD）或 XML 架构定义语言（XSD）架构。To define the structure of an XML document and its element relationships, data types, and content constraints, you use a document type definition (DTD) or XML Schema definition language (XSD) schema. 如果 XML 文档满足[W3C XML 1.0 建议](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/)定义的所有语法要求，则将其视为格式正确。An XML document is considered to be well formed if it meets all the syntactical requirements defined by the [W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/). 如果其格式正确并且符合其 DTD 或架构定义的约束，则将其视为有效。It's considered valid if it's well formed and also conforms to the constraints defined by its DTD or schema. （请参阅[W3C Xml 架构第1部分：结构](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-1/)和[W3c xml 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/)建议。）因此，虽然所有有效的 XML 文档的格式正确，但并不是所有格式正确的 XML 文档都是有效的。(See the [W3C XML Schema Part 1: Structures](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-1/) and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/) recommendations.) Therefore, although all valid XML documents are well formed, not all well-formed XML documents are valid. 可以针对 DTD、内联 XSD 架构或存储在 对象（缓存）中的 XSD 架构验证数据; 参考页上介绍了这些方案。You can validate the data against a DTD, an inline XSD Schema, or an XSD Schema stored in an object (a cache); these scenarios are described on the reference page. 不支持 XML 数据缩减（XDR）架构验证。 doesn't support XML-Data Reduced (XDR) schema validation. 对 类使用以下设置来指定 实例支持的验证类型（如果有）。You use the following settings on the class to specify what type of validation, if any, the instance supports. |使用此 成员Use this member|若要指定To specify| |-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------| | 属性 property|是否允许 DTD 处理。Whether to allow DTD processing. 默认设置为不允许 DTD 处理。The default is to disallow DTD processing.| | 属性 property|读取器是否应验证数据，以及要执行的验证类型（DTD 或架构）。Whether the reader should validate data, and what type of validation to perform (DTD or schema). 默认设置为无数据验证。The default is no data validation.| | 事件 event|用于接收有关验证事件的信息的事件处理程序。An event handler for receiving information about validation events. 如果未提供事件处理程序，在出现第一个验证错误时将引发 。If an event handler is not provided, an is thrown on the first validation error.| | 属性 property|通过 枚举成员的其他验证选项：Additional validation options through the enumeration members:

- `AllowXmlAttributes`--允许实例文档中的 XML 特性（`xml:*`），即使在架构中未定义也是如此。- `AllowXmlAttributes`-- Allow XML attributes (`xml:*`) in instance documents even when they're not defined in the schema. 属性基于其数据类型进行验证。The attributes are validated based on their data type. 有关在特定方案中使用的设置，请参阅 参考页。See the reference page for the setting to use in specific scenarios. （默认情况下禁用。）(Disabled by default.)
- `ProcessIdentityConstraints`--在验证期间遇到的进程标识约束（`xs:ID`、`xs:IDREF`、`xs:key`、`xs:keyref`、`xs:unique`）。- `ProcessIdentityConstraints` --Process identity constraints (`xs:ID`, `xs:IDREF`, `xs:key`, `xs:keyref`, `xs:unique`) encountered during validation. （默认情况下启用。）(Enabled by default.)
- `ProcessSchemaLocation` `xsi:schemaLocation` 或 `xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation` 特性指定的进程架构。- `ProcessSchemaLocation` --Process schemas specified by the `xsi:schemaLocation` or `xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation` attribute. （默认情况下启用。）(Enabled by default.)
- `ProcessInlineSchema`--在验证期间处理内联 XML 架构。- `ProcessInlineSchema`-- Process inline XML Schemas during validation. （默认情况下禁用。）(Disabled by default.)
- `ReportValidationWarnings`--如果出现验证警告，则报告事件。- `ReportValidationWarnings`--Report events if a validation warning occurs. 如果没有验证特定元素或属性时所依据的 DTD 或 XML 架构，通常会发出警告。A warning is typically issued when there is no DTD or XML Schema to validate a particular element or attribute against. 用于通知。The is used for notification. （默认情况下禁用。）(Disabled by default.)| ||用于验证的 。The to use for validation.| | 属性 property|用于解析和访问外部资源的 。The for resolving and accessing external resources. 这可能包括外部实体（例如 DTD 和架构）以及 XML 架构中包含的任何 `xs:include` 或 `xs:import` 元素。This can include external entities such as DTD and schemas, and any `xs:include` or `xs:import` elements contained in the XML Schema. 如果未指定 ，则 将使用没有用户凭据的默认 。If you don't specify an , the uses a default with no user credentials.| ## 数据一致性Data conformance 默认情况下， 方法创建的 XML 读取器满足以下符合性要求：XML readers that are created by the method meet the following compliance requirements by default: - 新行和属性值根据 W3C [XML 1.0 建议](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/)进行标准化。New lines and attribute value are normalized according to the W3C [XML 1.0 Recommendation](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/). - 所有实体都将自动展开。All entities are automatically expanded. - 即使读者不进行验证，也会始终添加在文档类型定义中声明的默认属性。Default attributes declared in the document type definition are always added even when the reader doesn't validate. - 允许声明映射到正确的 XML 命名空间 URI 的 XML 前缀。Declaration of XML prefix mapped to the correct XML namespace URI is allowed. - 单个 `NotationType` 属性声明中的表示法名称和 `NmTokens` 在单个 `Enumeration` 特性声明中是不同的。The notation names in a single `NotationType` attribute declaration and `NmTokens` in a single `Enumeration` attribute declaration are distinct. 使用这些 属性来指定要启用的一致性检查类型：Use these properties to specify the type of conformance checks you want to enable: |使用此 属性Use this property|至To|默认Default| |-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------|-------------| | 属性 property|为以下项启用或禁用检查：Enable or disable checks for the following:

-字符在合法 XML 字符范围内，由 W3C XML 1.0 建议的[2.2 字符](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#charsets)部分定义。- Characters are within the range of legal XML characters, as defined by the [2.2 Characters](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#charsets) section of the W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation.
-所有 XML 名称都有效，如 W3C XML 1.0 建议的[2.3 通用语法构造](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#NT-Name)部分所定义。- All XML names are valid, as defined by the [2.3 Common Syntactic Constructs](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#NT-Name) section of the W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation.

当此属性设置为 `true` （默认值）时，如果 XML 文件包含非法字符或无效的 XML 名称（例如，元素名称以数字开头），则会引发 异常。When this property is set to `true` (default), an exception is thrown if the XML file contains illegal characters or invalid XML names (for example, an element name starts with a number).|启用了字符和名称检查。Character and name checking is enabled.

将 设置为 `false` 会禁用对字符实体引用的字符检查。Setting to `false` turns off character checking for character entity references. 如果读取器正在处理文本数据，不管此设置如何，它都始终检查 XML 名称是否有效。If the reader is processing text data, it always checks that XML names are valid, regardless of this setting. **注意：** 存在 DTD 时，XML 1.0 建议要求文档级别的一致性。**Note:** The XML 1.0 recommendation requires document-level conformance when a DTD is present. 因此，如果读取器配置为支持 ，但 XML 数据包含文档类型定义（DTD），则会引发 。Therefore, if the reader is configured to support , but the XML data contains a document type definition (DTD), an is thrown.| | 属性 property|选择要强制执行的一致性级别：Choose the level of conformance to enforce:

- .- . 符合[格式正确的 XML 1.0 文档](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#sec-well-formed)的规则。Conforms to the rules for a [well-formed XML 1.0 document](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#sec-well-formed).
- .- . 符合可以作为[外部分析的实体](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#wf-entities)使用的格式正确的文档片段的规则。Conforms to the rules for a well-formed document fragment that can be consumed as an [external parsed entity](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#wf-entities).
- .- . 符合读取器决定的级别。Conforms to the level decided by the reader.

如果数据不符合，则会引发 异常。If the data isn't in conformance, an exception is thrown.|| ## 在节点间导航Navigating through nodes 当前节点是 XML 读取器当前定位在其上的 XML 节点。The current node is the XML node on which the XML reader is currently positioned. 所有 方法执行与此节点相关的操作，所有 属性都反映当前节点的值。All methods perform operations in relation to this node, and all properties reflect the value of the current node. 使用以下方法可以轻松地在节点之间导航和分析数据。The following methods make it easy to navigate through nodes and parse data. |使用此 方法Use this method|至To| |-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------| ||读取第一个节点，一次一个节点前进一个节点。Read the first node, and advance through the stream one node at a time. 此类调用通常在 `while` 循环内执行。Such calls are typically performed inside a `while` loop.

使用 属性可获取当前节点的类型（例如，特性、注释、元素等）。Use the property to get the type (for example, attribute, comment, element, and so on) of the current node.| ||跳过当前节点的子级并移至下一个节点。Skip the children of the current node and move to the next node.| | 和 and |跳过非内容节点，并移至下一个内容节点或文件结尾。Skip non-content nodes and move to the next content node or to the end of the file.

非内容节点包括 、、、和 。Non-content nodes include , , , , and .

内容节点包括非空白文本、、 和 。Content nodes include non-white space text, , , and .| ||读取元素及其所有子级，并将新的 实例设置为 。Read an element and all its children, and return a new instance set to .

此方法对于围绕 XML 元素创建边界很有用;例如，如果要将数据传递给另一个组件进行处理，并且希望限制该组件可以访问的数据量。This method is useful for creating boundaries around XML elements; for example, if you want to pass data to another component for processing and you want to limit how much of your data the component can access.| 请参阅 " 参考" 页，获取有关在文本流中一次导航一个节点并显示每个节点类型的示例。See the reference page for an example of navigating through a text stream one node at a time and displaying the type of each node. 以下各节介绍了如何读取特定类型的数据，例如元素、属性和类型化数据。The following sections describe how you can read specific types of data, such as elements, attributes, and typed data. ## 读取 XML 元素Reading XML elements 下表列出了 类提供的用于处理元素的方法和属性。The following table lists the methods and properties that the class provides for processing elements. 在 置于某个元素上之后，节点属性（例如 ）将反映元素的值。After the is positioned on an element, the node properties, such as , reflect the element values. 除了下面所述的成员之外， 类的任何常规方法和属性也可以用于处理元素。In addition to the members described below, any of the general methods and properties of the class can also be used to process elements. 例如，可以使用 方法读取元素的内容。For example, you can use the method to read the contents of an element. > [!NOTE] > 有关开始标记、结束标记和空元素标记的定义，请参阅[W3C XML 1.0 建议](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#sec-starttags)的3.1 节。See section 3.1 of the [W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#sec-starttags) for definitions of start tags, end tags, and empty element tags. |使用此 成员Use this member|至To| |---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------| | 方法 method|检查当前节点是否是开始标记或空元素标记。Check if the current node is a start tag or an empty element tag.| | 方法 method|检查当前节点是否为元素并将读取器推进到下一个节点（调用 后跟 ）。Check that the current node is an element and advance the reader to the next node (calls followed by ).| | 方法 method|检查当前节点是否为结束标记并将读取器推进到下一个节点。Check that the current node is an end tag and advance the reader to the next node.| | 方法 method|读取纯文本元素。Read a text-only element.| | 方法 method|将 XML 读取器前进到具有指定名称的下一个子代（子元素）元素。Advance the XML reader to the next descendant (child) element that has the specified name.| | 方法 method|将 XML 读取器前进到具有指定名称的下一个同级元素。Advance the XML reader to the next sibling element that has the specified name.| | 属性 property|检查当前元素是否具有结束元素标记。Check if the current element has an end element tag. 例如：For example:

- `` （ 是 `true`的。）- `` ( is `true`.)
- ` ` （ `false`，但元素内容为空。）- ` ` ( is `false`, although the element's content is empty.)| 有关读取元素的文本内容的示例，请参阅 方法。For an example of reading the text content of elements, see the method. 下面的示例通过使用 `while` 循环来处理元素。The following example processes elements by using a `while` loop. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#10)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#10)] ## 读取 XML 特性Reading XML attributes XML 特性最常见于元素，但也可用于 XML 声明和文档类型节点。XML attributes are most commonly found on elements, but they're also allowed on XML declaration and document type nodes. 当定位在元素节点上时， 方法允许您浏览元素的属性列表。When positioned on an element node, the method lets you go through the attribute list of the element. 请注意，在调用 之后，节点属性（如 、和 反映了该属性的属性，而不是该属性所属的元素的属性。Note that after has been called, node properties such as , , and reflect the properties of that attribute, not the properties of the element the attribute belongs to. 类提供这些方法和属性来读取和处理元素上的属性。The class provides these methods and properties to read and process attributes on elements. |使用此 成员Use this member|至To| |---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------| | 属性 property|检查当前节点是否有任何属性。Check whether the current node has any attributes.| | 属性 property|获取当前元素的属性数。Get the number of attributes on the current element.| | 方法 method|移动到元素中的第一个属性。Move to the first attribute in an element.| | 方法 method|转到元素中的下一个属性。Move to the next attribute in an element.| | 方法 method|移动到指定的属性。Move to a specified attribute.| | 方法或 属性 method or property|获取指定特性的值。Get the value of a specified attribute.| | 属性 property|检查当前节点是否是从 DTD 或架构中定义的默认值生成的属性。Check whether the current node is an attribute that was generated from the default value defined in the DTD or schema.| | 方法 method|转到拥有当前特性的元素。Move to the element that owns the current attribute. 使用此方法可以在通过元素的属性导航后返回到元素。Use this method to return to an element after navigating through its attributes.| | 方法 method|将属性值分析为一个或多个 `Text`、`EntityReference`或 `EndEntity` 节点。Parse the attribute value into one or more `Text`, `EntityReference`, or `EndEntity` nodes.| 任何常规的 方法和属性也可以用于处理属性。Any of the general methods and properties can also be used to process attributes. 例如，在 位于某个属性上之后， 和 属性将反映该属性的值。For example, after the is positioned on an attribute, the and properties reflect the values of the attribute. 也可以使用任何内容 `Read` 方法来获取属性的值。You can also use any of the content `Read` methods to get the value of the attribute. 此示例使用 属性来浏览元素上的所有属性。This example uses the property to navigate through all the attributes on an element. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#1)] 此示例使用 `while` 循环中的 方法来浏览属性。This example uses the method in a `while` loop to navigate through the attributes. 读取 XML 内容Reading XML content XMLReader 类包含以下成员，这些成员从 XML 文件读取内容并将内容作为字符串值返回。The XMLReader class includes the following members that read content from an XML file and return the content as string values. （若要返回 CLR 类型，请参阅[下一节](#xmlreader_clr)。）(To return CLR types, see the [next section](#xmlreader_clr).) |使用此 成员Use this member|至To| |---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------| | 属性 property|获取当前节点的文本内容。Get the text content of the current node. 返回的值取决于节点类型;请参阅 参考页获取详细信息。The value returned depends on the node type; see the reference page for details.| | 方法 method|以字符串的形式获取元素或文本节点的内容。Get the content of an element or text node as a string. 此方法在处理指令和注释处停止。This method stops on processing instructions and comments.

`this`| ## 转换为 CLR 类型Converting to CLR types 您可以使用 类的成员（下表中列出）来读取 XML 数据并返回值作为公共语言运行时（CLR）类型而不是字符串。You can use the members of the class (listed in the following table) to read XML data and return values as common language runtime (CLR) types instead of strings. 这些成员使你能够获取最适合你的编码任务的表示形式的值，而无需手动分析或转换字符串值。These members enable you to get values in the representation that is most appropriate for your coding task without having to manually parse or convert string values. - 只能在元素节点类型上调用**ReadElementContentAs**方法。The **ReadElementContentAs** methods can only be called on element node types. 这些方法不能在包含子元素或混合内容的元素上使用。These methods cannot be used on elements that contain child elements or mixed content. 在调用时， 对象读取开始标记，读取元素内容，然后移过结束元素标记。When called, the object reads the start tag, reads the element content, and then moves past the end element tag. 将忽略处理指令和注释并展开实体。Processing instructions and comments are ignored and entities are expanded. - **ReadContentAs**方法读取当前读取器位置处的文本内容，如果 XML 数据没有任何与之关联的架构或数据类型信息，则将文本内容转换为请求的返回类型。The **ReadContentAs** methods read the text content at the current reader position, and if the XML data doesn't have any schema or data type information associated with it, convert the text content to the requested return type. 文本、空白、有效空白和 CDATA 节串联在一起。Text, white space, significant white space and CDATA sections are concatenated. 将跳过注释和处理指令，并自动解析实体引用。Comments and processing instructions are skipped, and entity references are automatically resolved. 类使用[W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/)建议定义的规则。The class uses the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/) recommendation. |使用此 方法Use this method|返回此 CLR 类型To return this CLR type| property. 有关映射信息，请参阅 system.exception[类中的类型支持](/dotnet/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes)。See [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](/dotnet/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes) for mapping information.| 如果某个元素的格式无法轻松转换为 CLR 类型，则可以使用架构映射来确保成功转换。If an element can't easily be converted to a CLR type because of its format, you can use a schema mapping to ensure a successful conversion. 下面的示例使用 .xsd 文件将 `hire-date` 元素转换为 `xs:date` 类型，然后使用 方法将该元素作为 对象返回。The following example uses an .xsd file to Date: 7/8/2003 12:00:00 AM ``` ## 异步编程Asynchronous programming 大多数 方法的方法名称末尾都有 "Async"。Most of the methods have asynchronous counterparts that have "Async" at the end of their method names. 例如， following when working with the class: - 从 引发的异常可能会泄露您可能不希望冒泡到您的应用程序的路径信息。Exceptions thrown from the can disclose path information that you might not want bubbled up to your app. 应用必须捕获异常并对其进行相应处理。Your app must catch exceptions and process them appropriately. - 如果你担心拒绝服务问题，或者如果你正在处理不受信任的源，则不要启用 DTD 处理。Do not enable DTD processing if you're concerned about denial of service issues or if you're dealing with untrusted sources. 默认情况下，对 方法创建的 对象禁用 DTD 处理。DTD processing is disabled by default for objects created by the method. 如果启用了 DTD 处理，可以使用 限制 可以访问的资源。If you have DTD processing enabled, you can use the to restrict the resources that the can access. 你还可以设计应用程序，以便 XML 处理的内存和时间受到限制。You can also design your app so that the XML processing is memory and time constrained. 例如，可以在 ASP.NET 应用程序中配置超时限制。For example, you can configure time-out limits in your ASP.NET app. - XML 数据可以包含对外部资源（例如架构文件）的引用。XML data can include references to external resources such as a schema file. 默认情况下，使用没有用户凭据的 对象解析外部资源。By default, external resources are resolved by using an object with no user credentials. 通过执行下列操作之一，可以使此操作更加安全：You can secure this further by doing one of the following: - 通过将 属性设置为 对象限制 可访问的资源。Restrict the resources that the can access by setting the property to an object. - 通过将 属性设置为 ，不允许 `null` 打开任何外部资源。Do not allow the to open any external resources by setting the property to `null`. - 默认情况下，不会设置 对象的 和 验证标志。The and validation flags of an object aren't set by default. 这样，在处理来自不可信的源的 XML 数据时，可以帮助防止 受到基于架构的攻击。This helps to protect the against schema-based attacks when it is processing XML data from an untrusted source. 设置了这些标志后， 对象的 用于在 中解析实例文档中遇到的架构位置。When these flags are set, the of the object is used to resolve schema locations encountered in the instance document in the . 如果 属性设置为 `null`，则即使设置了 和 验证标志，也不会解析架构位置。If the property is set to `null`, schema locations aren't resolved even if the and validation flags are set. 在验证过程中添加的架构会添加新类型，并且可能更改被验证的文档的验证结果。Schemas added during validation add new types and can change the validation outcome of the document being validated. 因此，只应从可信的源解析外部架构。As a result, external schemas should only be resolved from trusted sources. 建议在高可用性方案中针对对文档的大部分具有标识约束的架构验证不受信任的大型 XML 文档时禁用 标志。We recommend disabling the flag when validating untrusted, large XML documents in high availability scenarios against a schema that has identity constraints over a large part of the document. 默认情况下启用此标志。This flag is enabled by default. - XML 数据可以包含大量属性、命名空间声明、嵌套元素等，需要大量的时间来处理。XML data can contain a large number of attributes, namespace declarations, nested elements and so on that require a substantial amount of time to process. 若要限制发送到 的输入的大小，可以：To limit the size of the input that is sent to the , you can: - 通过设置 属性来限制文档的大小。Limit the size of the document by setting the property. - 通过设置 属性，限制扩展实体所产生的字符数。Limit the number of characters that result from expanding entities by setting the property. - 为 创建自定义 `IStream` 实现。Create a custom `IStream` implementation for the . - 方法可用于处理大型数据流。The method can be used to handle large streams of data. 此方法一次读取少量的字符，而不是为整个值分配单个字符串。This method reads a small number of characters at a time instead of allocating a single string for the whole value. - 读取具有大量唯一本地名称、命名空间或前缀的 XML 文档时，可能会出现问题。When reading an XML document with a large number of unique local names, namespaces, or prefixes, a problem can occur. 如果使用派生自 的类，并且调用每个项的 、或 属性，则返回的字符串将添加到 中。If you are using a class that derives from , and you call the , , or property for each item, the returned string is added to a . 保存的集合的大小永远不会减小，这会造成字符串句柄的虚拟内存泄露。The collection held by the never decreases in size, creating a virtual memory leak of the string handles. 这一缓解措施是从 类派生，并强制实施最大大小配额。One mitigation for this is to derive from the class and enforce a maximum size quota. （无法阻止使用 ，或在 满时进行切换）。(There is no way to prevent the use of a , or to switch the when it is full). 另一种缓解措施是避免使用所述的属性，并在可能的情况下将 方法与 方法一起使用;这些方法不返回字符串，因此避免了 集合 overfilling 的问题。Another mitigation is to avoid using the properties mentioned and instead use the method with the method where possible; those methods don't return strings and thus avoid the problem of overfilling the collection. - 对象可以包含敏感信息，例如用户凭据。 objects can contain sensitive information such as user credentials. 不可信的组件可能会使用 对象及其用户凭据来创建 对象，以读取数据。An untrusted component could use the object and its user credentials to create objects to read data. 在缓存 对象或将 对象从一个组件传递到另一个组件时，请小心。Be careful when caching objects, or when passing the object from one component to another. - 不接受来自不可信的源的支持组件，例如 、 和 对象。Do not accept supporting components, such as , , and objects, from an untrusted source. ## Examples 下面的示例代码演示如何使用异步 API 来分析 XML。The following example code shows how to use the asynchronous API to parse XML. remarks.format: ## Remarks 联网的 XML 文档包含使用各种 W3C 标准包含机制聚合的数据块，因此包含来自不同位置的节点。A networked XML document is comprised of chunks of data aggregated using various W3C standard inclusion mechanisms and therefore contains nodes that come from different places. DTD 实体就是这样一个例子，但这并不局限于 Dtd。DTD entities are an example of this, but this is not limited to DTDs. 基本 URI 告诉您这些节点的来源。The base URI tells you where these nodes came from. 如果返回的节点没有基 URI （例如，从内存中字符串中对其进行了分析），将返回 `String.Empty`。If there is no base URI for the nodes being returned (for example, they were parsed from an in-memory string), `String.Empty` is returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法还释放读取过程中保留的任何资源。This method also releases any resources held during reading. 如果已调用 ，则不执行任何操作。If has already been called, no action is performed.

span.span: An method was called before a previous asynchronous operation finished.

span.span: Creates a new instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 大多数 重载都包含一个接受 对象的 `settings` 参数。Most of the overloads include a `settings` parameter that accepts an object. 您可以使用此对象执行以下操作：You can use this object to: - 指定要在 对象上支持的功能。Specify which features you want supported on the object. - 重新使用 对象以创建多个读取器。Reuse the object to create multiple readers. 可以使用相同的设置创建多个具有相同功能的读取器。You can use the same settings to create multiple readers with the same functionality. 或者，您可以修改 实例上的设置，并使用一组不同的功能创建新的读取器。Or, you can modify the settings on an instance and create a new reader with a different set of features. - 向现有的 XML 读取器添加功能。Add features to an existing XML reader. 方法可以接受其他 对象。The method can accept another object. 基础 对象可以是用户定义的读取器、 对象或要向其添加附加功能的另一个 实例。The underlying object can be a user-defined reader, a object, or another instance that you want to add additional features to. - 充分利用功能，如更好的一致性检查和符合[XML 1.0 （第四版）](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/)建议，这些建议仅在静态 方法创建 对象上可用。Take full advantage of features such as better conformance checking and compliance to the [XML 1.0 (fourth edition)](https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/) recommendation that are available only on objects created by the static method. > [!NOTE] > 尽管 .NET Framework 包括 类的具体实现，如 、和 类，但建议使用 方法创建 的实例。Although the .NET Framework includes concrete implementations of the class, such as the , , and the classes, we recommend that you create instances by using the method. ## 默认设置Default settings 如果使用不接受 对象的 重载，则使用以下默认读取器设置：If you use a overload that doesn't accept a object, the following default reader settings are used: |设置Setting|默认Default| |-------------|-------------| ||`true`| ||| ||`false`| ||`false`| ||`false`| ||00| ||00| ||`null`| ||| ||空的 对象An empty object| || 启用 enabled| ||| ||一个新的 对象。A new object. 从 .NET Framework 4.5.2 开始，此设置的默认值为 "`null`"。Starting with the .NET Framework 4.5.2, this setting has a default value of `null`.| ## 常见方案的设置Settings for common scenarios 下面是应该为一些典型的 XML 读取器方案设置的 属性。Here are the properties you should set for some of the typical XML reader scenarios. |要求Requirement|设置Set| |-----------------|---------| |数据必须是格式正确的 XML 文档。Data must be a well-formed XML document.| 。 to .| |数据必须是格式正确的 XML 分析实体。Data must be a well-formed XML parsed entity.| 。 to .| |数据必须针对 DTD 进行验证。Data must be validated against a DTD.| 到 to
。 to .| |必须根据 XML 架构对数据进行验证。Data must be validated against an XML schema.| 到 to
到要用于验证的 。 to the to use for validation. 请注意， 不支持 XML 数据缩减（XDR）架构验证。Note that doesn't support XML-Data Reduced (XDR) schema validation.| |必须根据内联 XML 架构对数据进行验证。Data must be validated against an inline XML schema.| 到 to
。 to .| |类型支持。Type support.| 到 to
要使用的 。 to the to use.| 不支持 XML 数据缩减（XDR）架构验证。 doesn't support XML-Data Reduced (XDR) schema validation. ## 异步编程Asynchronous programming 在同步模式下， 方法从文件、流或文本读取器的缓冲区中读取第一个数据块。In synchronous mode, the method reads the first chunk of data from the buffer of the file, stream, or text reader. 如果 i/o 操作失败，这可能会引发异常。This may throw an exception if an I/O operation fails. 在异步模式下，第一次 i/o 操作的执行是读取操作，因此，发生读取操作时会引发发生的异常。In asynchronous mode, the first I/O operation occurs with a read operation, so exceptions that arise will be thrown when the read operation occurs. ## 安全注意事项Security considerations 默认情况下， 使用没有用户凭据的 对象来打开资源。By default, the uses an object with no user credentials to open resources. 这意味着，默认情况下，XML 读取器可以访问不需要凭据的任何位置。This means that, by default, the XML reader can access any location that doesn't require credentials. 使用 属性控制对资源的访问：Use the property to control access to resources: - 将 设置为 对象，以限制 XML 读取器可以访问的资源。Set to an object to restrict the resources that the XML reader can access. - 或 --or- - 将 设置为 `null`，以防止 XML 读取器打开任何外部资源。Set to `null` to prevent the XML reader from opening any external resources. ## Examples 此示例将创建一个 XML 读取器，该读取器可去除无意义的空白、去除注释并执行片段级别的一致性检查。This example creates an XML reader that strips insignificant white space, strips comments, and performs fragment-level conformance checking. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.Create#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/CS/XmlReader_Create.cs#11)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.Create#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/VB/XmlReader_Create.vb#11)] 下面的示例使用具有默认凭据的 来访问文件。The following example uses an with default credentials to access a file. [!code-cpp[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/CPP/XmlReaderSettings.cctor.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/CS/factory_rdr_cctor2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/VB/factory_rdr_cctor2.vb#1)] [!code-cpp[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/CPP/XmlReaderSettings.cctor.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/CS/factory_rdr_cctor2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/VB/factory_rdr_cctor2.vb#2)] 下面的代码在其他读取器中包装一个读取器实例。The following code wraps a reader instance within another reader. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.Create#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/CS/XmlReader_Create.cs#13)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.Create#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/VB/XmlReader_Create.vb#13)] 此示例将读取器链接到添加 DTD 和 XML 架构验证。This example chains readers to add DTD and XML schema validation. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.Create#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/CS/XmlReader_Create.cs#12)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.Create#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/VB/XmlReader_Create.vb#12)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用默认设置的 对象用于创建读取器。An object with default settings is used to create the reader. 如果希望在创建的读取器上指定支持的功能，请使用将 对象作为其参数之一的重载，并传入具有正确设置的 对象。If you wish to specify the features to support on the created reader, use the overload that takes an object as one of its arguments, and pass in an object with the correct settings. 不带凭据的默认 用于访问任何外部资源，例如文档类型定义（DTD）、实体和架构等。A default with no credentials is used to access any external resources such as a document type definition (DTD), entities, schemas, and so on. > [!IMPORTANT] > 从 .NET Framework 4.5.2 开始，不提供默认 。Starting with the .NET Framework 4.5.2, no default is provided. 如果你的解决方案面向 .NET Framework 4.5.2 或更高版本，请使用 属性指定 。If your solution targets the .NET Framework 4.5.2 or later versions, specify an using the property. 如果外部资源位于要求身份验证的网络资源上，则使用 属性指定具有所需凭据的 。If the external resource is located on a network resource that requires authentication, specify an with the necessary credentials using the property. 创建的 对象扩展实体引用并执行新行字符的 XML 规范化。The created object expands entity references and performs XML normalization of new line characters. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个从 读取的 对象。The following example creates an object that reads from a . returns.span: 一个用于读取数据流中所含数据的对象。

span.span: An object that is used to read the XML data in the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，不带凭据的 用于访问任何外部资源，例如文档类型定义（DTD）、实体、架构等。By default an with no credentials is used to access any external resources such as a document type definition (DTD), entities, schemas, and so on. > [!IMPORTANT] > 从 .NET Framework 4.5.2 开始，不提供默认 。Starting with the .NET Framework 4.5.2, no default is provided. 如果你的解决方案面向 .NET Framework 4.5.2 或更高版本，请使用 属性指定 。If your solution targets the .NET Framework 4.5.2 or later versions, specify an using the property. 这意味着 可以访问不需要身份验证的任何位置。This means that the can access any locations that does not require authentication. 如果外部资源位于要求身份验证的网络资源上，请使用 属性指定具有所需凭据的 。If the external resource is located on a network resource that requires authentication, use the property to specify an with the necessary credentials. > [!IMPORTANT] > 可以通过将 属性设置为 对象，来限制 可以访问的资源。You can restrict the resources that the can access by setting the property to an object. 创建的 对象扩展实体引用并执行新行字符的 XML 规范化。The created object expands entity references and performs XML normalization of new line characters. ## Examples 下面的示例创建支持文档类型定义（DTD）验证的 对象。The following example creates an object that supports document type definition (DTD) validation. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.Create#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/CS/XmlReader_Create.cs#3)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.Create#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/VB/XmlReader_Create.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法允许你向基础 对象添加其他功能。This method allows you add additional features to an underlying object. 基础 对象可以是 方法创建的另一个 对象，也可以是使用一个具体 实现创建的 对象。The underlying object can be another object created by the method, or an object created using one of the concrete implementations. 不带凭据的默认 用于访问任何外部资源（如架构）。A default with no credentials is used to access any external resources such as a schema. > [!IMPORTANT] > 从 .NET Framework 4.5.2 开始，不提供默认 。Starting with the .NET Framework 4.5.2, no default is provided. 如果你的解决方案面向 .NET Framework 4.5.2 或更高版本，请使用 属性指定 。If your solution targets the .NET Framework 4.5.2 or later versions, specify an using the property. 如果外部资源位于要求身份验证的网络资源上，则使用 属性指定具有所需凭据的 。If the external resource is located on a network resource that requires authentication, specify an with the necessary credentials using the property. > [!IMPORTANT] > 你可以使用以下方法之一来控制 可以访问的资源：You can use one of the following methods to control which resources the can access: > > - 通过将 属性设置为 对象限制 可访问的资源。Restrict the resources that the can access by setting the property to an object. > > - 或 --or- > > - 通过将 属性设置为 ，不允许 `null` 打开任何外部资源。Do not allow the to open any external resources by setting the property to `null`. 创建的 对象扩展实体引用并执行新行字符的 XML 规范化。The created object expands entity references and performs XML normalization of new line characters. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个验证 对象，该对象围绕 对象进行包装。The following example creates a validating object that is wrapped around an object. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.Create#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/CS/XmlReader_Create.cs#5)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.Create#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/VB/XmlReader_Create.vb#5)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 以下 XML 包含特定命名空间中的属性：The following XML contains an attribute in a specific namespace: ```xml ``` 可以使用一个参数（前缀和本地名称）或两个参数（本地名称和命名空间 URI）来查找 `dt:type` 特性：You can lookup the `dt:type` attribute using one argument (prefix and local name) or two arguments (local name and namespace URI): ```csharp String dt = reader.GetAttribute("dt:type"); String dt2 = reader.GetAttribute("type","urn:datatypes"); ``` 若要查找 `xmlns:dt` 属性，请使用以下参数之一：To lookup the `xmlns:dt` attribute, use one of the following arguments: ```csharp String dt3 = reader.GetAttribute("xmlns:dt"); String dt4 = reader.GetAttribute("dt",http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/); ``` 你还可以使用 属性获取此信息。You can also get this information using the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 下表列出具有要返回的值的节点类型。The following table lists node types that have a value to return. |节点类型Node Type|值Value| |---------------|-----------| |`Attribute`|属性的值。The value of the attribute.| |`CDATA`|CDATA 节的内容。The content of the CDATA section.| |`Comment`|注释的内容。The content of the comment.| |`DocumentType`|内部子集。The internal subset.| |`ProcessingInstruction`|全部内容（不包括指令目标）。The entire content, excluding the target.| |`SignificantWhitespace`|混合内容模型中标记之间的空白。The white space between markup in a mixed content model.| |`Text`|文本节点的内容。The content of the text node.| |`Whitespace`|标记之间的空白。The white space between markup.| |`XmlDeclaration`|声明的内容。The content of the declaration.| ## Examples 有关使用此方法的示例，请参阅 （在 `XmlTextReader` 类中）。See (in the `XmlTextReader` class) for a sample using this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性使您能够确定下面各项之间的差异：This property enables you to determine the difference between the following: `` （`IsEmptyElement` `true`）。`` (`IsEmptyElement` is `true`). `` （`IsEmptyElement` `false`，但元素内容为空）。`` (`IsEmptyElement` is `false`, although element content is empty). 不会为空元素生成相应的 `EndElement` 节点。A corresponding `EndElement` node is not generated for empty elements. 如果由于架构验证而将默认内容添加到元素，`IsEmptyElement` 仍返回 `true`。If default content has been added to an element due to schema validation, `IsEmptyElement` still returns `true`. 它与元素是否具有默认值无关。It has no bearing on whether or not the element has a default value. 换句话说，`IsEmptyElement` 仅报告源文档中的元素是否具有结束元素标记。In other words, `IsEmptyElement` simply reports whether or not the element in the source document had an end element tag. ## Examples 下面的示例显示每个元素的文本内容。The following example displays the text content of each element. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#10)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#10)] 该示例使用文件（`elems.xml`）作为输入。The example uses the file, `elems.xml`, as input. span.span: The enabling you to get the atomized version of a string within the node.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 返回的所有节点和属性名称都使用 `NameTable`进行原子化。All node and attribute names returned from are atomized using the `NameTable`. 如果多次返回相同的名称（例如 `Customer`），则将为该名称返回相同的 `String` 对象。When the same name is returned multiple times (for example, `Customer`), then the same `String` object will be returned for that name. 这样一来，就可以编写有效的代码，对这些字符串进行对象比较，而不是对开销较高的字符串进行比较。This makes it possible for you to write efficient code that does object comparisons on these strings instead of expensive string comparisons.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 首次创建和初始化 时，没有可用的信息。When an is first created and initialized, there is no information available. 必须调用 才能读取第一个节点。You must call to read the first node. 方法将 XML 读取器的状态设置为启动 并按顺序在 XML 文件中移动，直到它到达文件的末尾，此时该方法返回 `false`的值。The method sets the state of the XML reader to initiate and moves through the XML file sequentially until it reaches the end of the file, at which point the method returns a value of `false`. 此方法至少需要数据流中的四个字节，才能开始分析。This method requires at least four bytes from the data stream in order to begin parsing. 如果返回的字节数少于四个，并且流中没有更多的数据，则该方法将返回 `false`。If fewer than four bytes are returned and there is no more data in the stream, the method returns `false`. 如果流中有更多数据，该方法将会阻止分析，直到收到第四个字节。If there is more data in the stream, the method will block parsing until receipt of the fourth byte. 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例读取 XML 文件并显示每个节点：The following example reads an XML file and displays each of the nodes: [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#8)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#8)] 该示例使用 `items.xml` 文件。The sample uses the `items.xml` file. summary.span: 将内容作为指定类型的对象读取。

span.span: Reads the content as an object of the type specified.

returns.span: 已转换为请求类型的串联文本内容或属性值。

span.span: The concatenated text content or attribute value converted to the requested type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 此方法读取当前读取器位置处的文本内容，并将其转换为请求的返回类型。This method reads the text content at the current reader position and converts it to the requested return type. 文本、空白、有效空白和 CDATA 节串联在一起。Text, white space, significant white space and CDATA sections are concatenated. 跳过注释和处理指令，并自动解析实体引用。Comments and processing instructions are skipped and entity references are automatically resolved. 此方法用于读取、转换（如有必要），并从当前节点内容返回原子值项。This method is used to read, convert if necessary, and return atomic value items from the current node content. 如果输入类型是当前节点的类型的有效映射，则返回包含当前节点的值的目标类型的实例。If the input type is a valid mappings for the type of the current node then an instance of the target type containing the value of the current node is returned. 有关默认映射的列表，请参阅 引用 "页中的" 备注 "部分。See the Remarks section in the reference page for a list of the default mappings. 例如，如果有以下 XML 文本：For example, if you had the following XML text: ```xml 123 456 ``` 如果数据已类型化并向 方法调用提供了字符串数组，则根据有效 CLR 类型映射的列表，将整数值转换为字符串。If the data is typed and a string array is supplied to the method call, then the integer values are converted from strings according to the list of valid CLR type mappings. 如果数据是非类型化的，并且为 方法调用提供了字符串数组，则会将内容解析为不同的字符串。If the data is untyped and a string array is supplied to the method call, then the content is parsed into separate strings. 返回一个包含两个字符串的数组，其值为 "123" 和 "456"。An array containing two strings is returned with the values "123" and "456". 不会保留内容中的空格。The spaces are not preserved from the content. 通常，在读取非类型化数据时，将根据提供的类型分析内容。In general when reading untyped data the content is parsed according to the supplied type. 例如，如果向 方法调用提供了一个整数数组，则该字符串将分析为 {123,456}的整数数组。For example, if an integer array is supplied to the method call then the string is parsed into an array of integers {123,456}. 在下面的示例中，XML 文本不由空格分隔In the following example the XML text is not separated by spaces ```xml 123456789 ``` 如果内容是非类型化的，并且为 方法调用提供了字符串数组，则返回一个包含一个串联字符串的数组，其值为 "123456789"。If the content is untyped and a string array is supplied to the method call then an array containing one concatenated string is returned with the value "123456789". 下表描述了此方法如何处理每个节点类型。The following table describes how this method treats each node type. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|返回值Return value|读取器行为Reader behavior| |-----------------|------------------|---------------------| |`Text`

`CDATA`

`Whitespace`

`SignificantWhitespace`

`EntityReference`

`EndEntity`|将文本、CDATA、空白和有效空白节点的串联内容转换为所请求的类型。Concatenated content of text, CDATA, white space and significant white space nodes converted to the requested type.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`Attribute`|与对属性值调用 `XmlConvert.ToXxx` 相同。Same as calling `XmlConvert.ToXxx` on the attribute value.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Comment`

`ProcessingInstruction`|忽略处理指令 (PI) 或注释，读取 PI 或注释后面的串联文本内容。Ignores the processing instruction (PI) or comment and reads the concatenated text content that follows the PI or comment.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`EndElement`|一个空字符串。An empty string.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Element`

`XmlDeclaration`

`None`

`Document`

`Notation`

`Entity`

`DocumentFragment`|引发 。An is thrown.|未定义，尽管通常读取器将保留在当前位置。Undefined, although typically the reader remains in the current position.| 有关详细信息，请参阅 " 引用" 页和 " [W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议" 的 "备注" 部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法将 colors 元素的内容返回到字符串对象数组中。The following example uses the method to return the contents of the colors element into an array of string objects. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法对内容进行流式处理，对 `Base64` 的内容进行解码，并将解码后的二进制字节（例如内联 `Base64` 编码 GIF 图像）返回到缓冲区中。This method streams the content, decodes the `Base64` content, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline `Base64` encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 可以连续调用此方法以读取大量嵌入文本。This method can be called successively to read large streams of embedded text. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 1521 "MIME （多用途 Internet 邮件扩展）第一部分：指定和描述 Internet 邮件正文格式的机制"。For more information, see RFC 1521, "MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) Part One: Mechanisms for Specifying and Describing the Format of Internet Message Bodies". 你可以从[征求意见](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37119)网站获取 rfc。You can obtain RFCs from the [Request for Comments Web site](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37119). > [!NOTE] > 在方法返回 `0`的值之前，不应访问 方法的调用之间的任何读取器属性。You should not access any of the reader properties between calls to the method until the method returns the value `0`. 此方法具有以下行为：This method has the following behavior: - 返回值，该值 `0` 达到其所操作的字节流的末尾。 returns the value `0` when it has reached the end of the byte stream it was operating on. 读取器定位在第一个非内容节点上。The reader is positioned on the first non-content node. - 如果要求的数量少于或等于的字节数，则读取器将保留在其当前位置。If you ask for fewer, or the exact number of, bytes than are left in the stream the reader remains in its current position. - 以下 XML 节点类型不支持 ： `Element`、`XmlDeclaration`、`None`、`Document`、`DocumentType`、`Notation`、`Entity`、`DocumentFragment`。 is not supported on the following XML node types: `Element`, `XmlDeclaration`, `None`, `Document`, `DocumentType`, `Notation`, `Entity`, `DocumentFragment`. 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see .

summary.span: 将当前位置的文本内容作为 读取。

span.span: Reads the text content at the current position as a .

returns.span: 作为 对象的文本内容。

remarks.format:
## Remarks 此方法连接文本、空格、有效空白和 CDATA 部分，并跳过任何注释或处理指令。This method concatenates text, white space, significant white space, and CDATA sections, and skips any comments or processing instructions. 实体引用会自动得到解决。Entity references are automatically resolved. 如果内容是类型 `xsd:boolean`，则读取器将返回取消装箱 对象。If the content is typed `xsd:boolean`, the reader returns an unboxed object. 如果内容不是类型化的 `xsd:boolean`，则读取器将根据[W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议中定义的规则尝试将其转换为 的对象。If the content is not typed `xsd:boolean`, the reader attempts to convert it to a object according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 下表描述了此方法如何处理每个节点类型。The following table describes how this method treats each node type. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|返回值Return value|读取器行为Reader behavior| |-----------------|------------------|---------------------| |`Text`

`CDATA`

`Whitespace`

`SignificantWhitespace`

`EntityReference`

`EndEntity`|将文本、CDATA、空白和有效空白节点的串联内容转换为所请求的类型。Concatenated content of text, CDATA, white space and significant white space nodes converted to the requested type.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`Attribute`|与对属性值调用 `XmlConvert.ToXxx` 相同。Same as calling `XmlConvert.ToXxx` on the attribute value.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Comment`

summary.span: 将当前位置的文本内容作为 对象读取。

remarks.format:
## Remarks 此方法连接文本、空格、有效空白和 CDATA 部分，并跳过任何注释或处理指令。This method concatenates text, white space, significant white space, and CDATA sections, and skips any comments or processing instructions. 实体引用会自动得到解决。Entity references are automatically resolved. 如果内容是类型 `xsd:dateTime`，则读取器将返回取消装箱 对象。If the content is typed `xsd:dateTime`, the reader returns an unboxed object. 如果内容不是类型化的 `xsd:dateTime`，则读取器将根据[W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议中定义的规则尝试将其转换为 的对象。If the content is not typed `xsd:dateTime`, the reader attempts to convert it to a object according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. > [!NOTE] > 如果内容类型化为 ，则不能使用 `xsd:gMonthDay` 值。You cannot rely on the value when the content is typed as `xsd:gMonthDay`. 在这种情况下 始终将 值设置为1904。 always sets the value to 1904 in this case. 下表描述了此方法如何处理每个节点类型。The following table describes how this method treats each node type. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|返回值Return value|读取器行为Reader behavior| |-----------------|------------------|---------------------| |`Text`

`CDATA`

`Whitespace`

`SignificantWhitespace`

`EntityReference`

`ProcessingInstruction`|忽略处理指令 (PI) 或注释，读取 PI 或注释后面的串联文本内容。Ignores the processing instruction (PI) or comment and reads the concatenated text content that follows the PI or comment.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`EndElement`|一个空字符串。An empty string.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Element`

## Remarks 此方法连接文本、空格、有效空白和 CDATA 部分，并跳过任何注释或处理指令。This method concatenates text, white space, significant white space, and CDATA sections, and skips any comments or processing instructions. 实体引用会自动得到解决。Entity references are automatically resolved. 如果内容是类型 `xsd:long`，则读取器将返回取消装箱的64位有符号整数。If the content is typed `xsd:long`, the reader returns an unboxed 64-bit signed integer. 如果内容不是类型化的 `xsd:long`，则读取器将根据[W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议中定义的规则尝试将其转换为64位有符号整数。If the content is not typed `xsd:long`, the reader attempts to convert it to a 64-bit signed integer according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 下表描述了此方法如何处理每个节点类型。The following table describes this method treats each node type. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|返回值Return value|读取器行为Reader behavior| |-----------------|------------------|---------------------| |`Text`

`CDATA`

`Whitespace`

`SignificantWhitespace`

`EntityReference`

`EndEntity`|将文本、CDATA、空白和有效空白节点的串联内容转换为所请求的类型。Concatenated content of text, CDATA, white space and significant white space nodes converted to the requested type.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`Attribute`|与属性值 `XmlConvert.ToXxx` 相同。Same as `XmlConvert.ToXxx` on attribute value.|读取器保持在当前位置The reader remains in the current position| |`Comment`

`ProcessingInstruction`|忽略处理指令 (PI) 或注释，读取 PI 或注释后面的串联文本内容。Ignores the processing instruction (PI) or comment and reads the concatenated text content that follows the PI or comment.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`EndElement`|一个空字符串。An empty string.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Element`

`XmlDeclaration`

`None`

`Document`

`DocumentType`

`Notation`

`Entity`

`DocumentFragment`|引发 。An is thrown.|未定义，尽管通常读取器将保留在当前位置。Undefined, although typically the reader remains in the current position.| 有关详细信息，请参阅 引用页的“备注”部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 此方法连接文本、空格、有效空白和 CDATA 部分，并跳过任何注释或处理指令。This method concatenates text, white space, significant white space, and CDATA sections, and skips any comments or processing instructions. 实体引用会自动得到解决。Entity references are automatically resolved. 如果内容是类型化的，则读取器将返回由 属性指定的最适合类型的已装箱 CLR。If the content is typed, the reader returns a boxed CLR of the most appropriate type, specified by the property. 如果内容是列表类型，则读取器将返回适当类型的装箱对象的数组。If the content is a list type, the reader returns an array of boxed objects of the appropriate type. > [!NOTE] > 如果在分析内容时出现验证错误，读取器是 方法创建的 对象，则读取器将内容作为字符串返回。If a validation error occurs while parsing the content and the reader is an object created by the method, the reader returns the content as a string. 换句话说，当发生验证错误或警告时，内容将被视为非类型化的。In other words when a validation error or warning occurs, the content is considered to be untyped. 如果内容未类型化，读取器将以字符串的形式返回内容。If the content is not typed, the reader returns the content as a string. 下表描述了此方法如何处理每个节点类型。The following table describes how this method treats each node type. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|返回值Return value|读取器行为Reader behavior| |-----------------|------------------|---------------------| |`Text`

`CDATA`

`Whitespace`

`SignificantWhitespace`

`EntityReference`

`EndEntity`|将文本、CDATA、空白和有效空白节点的串联内容转换为所请求的类型。Concatenated content of text, CDATA, white space and significant white space nodes converted to the requested type.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`Attribute`|与对属性值调用 `XmlConvert.ToXxx` 相同。Same as calling `XmlConvert.ToXxx` on the attribute value.|读取器保持在当前位置The reader remains in the current position| |`Comment`

`ProcessingInstruction`|忽略处理指令 (PI) 或注释，读取 PI 或注释后面的串联文本内容。Ignores the processing instruction (PI) or comment and reads the concatenated text content that follows the PI or comment.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`EndElement`|如果读取器是架构验证读取器（ 设置为 ），则为元素的值;否则为空字符串。The value of the element if the reader is a schema validating reader ( is set to ); otherwise an empty string.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Element`

`XmlDeclaration`

`None`

`Document`

`DocumentType`

`Notation`

`Entity`

`DocumentFragment`|引发 。An is thrown.|未定义，尽管通常读取器将保留在当前位置。Undefined, although typically the reader remains in the current position.| 有关详细信息，请参阅 " 引用" 页和 " [W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议" 的 "备注" 部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记和元素的内容，并将读取器移动到结束元素标记之后。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 它扩展实体并忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 有关详细信息，请参阅 " 引用" 页和 " [W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议" 的 "备注" 部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法读取 `date` 节点的内容。The following example uses the method to read the content of the `date` node. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/CS/readElementContentAs.cs#5)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/VB/readElementContentAs.vb#5)] 示例使用 `dataFile.xml` 文件作为输入。The example uses the `dataFile.xml` file as input. [!code-xml[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#8](~/samples/snippets/xml/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/XML/dataFile.xml#8)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取元素内容，使用 `Base64` 编码对其进行解码，并将解码后的二进制字节（例如内联 `Base64`编码 GIF 图像）返回到缓冲区中。This method reads the element content, decodes it using `Base64` encoding, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline `Base64`-encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 1521 "MIME （多用途 Internet 邮件扩展）第一部分：指定和描述 Internet 邮件正文格式的机制"。For more information, see RFC 1521, "MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) Part One: Mechanisms for Specifying and Describing the Format of Internet Message Bodies". 你可以从[征求意见](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37119)网站获取 rfc。You can obtain RFCs from the [Request for Comments Web site](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37119). 只能读取简单内容元素。 can only read simple-content elements. 元素可以包含文本、空格、有效空白、CDATA 部分、注释和处理指令。The element can contain text, white space, significant white space, CDATA sections, comments and processing instructions. 它还可以包含自动扩展的实体引用。It can also contain entity references, which are automatically expanded. 元素不能有子元素。The element cannot have child elements. 此方法与 方法非常相似，只不过它只能在元素节点类型上调用。This method is very similar to the method except that it can only be called on element node types. 如果 `count` 值大于文档中的字节数，或者它等于文档中的字节数，则 读取文档中的所有剩余字节并返回读取的字节数。If the `count` value is higher than the number of bytes in the document, or if it is equal to the number of bytes in the document, the reads all the remaining bytes in the document and returns the number of bytes read. 下一个 方法调用返回零，并将读取器移动到 `EndElement`后的节点。The next method call returns a zero and moves the reader to the node following the `EndElement`. 如果在所有元素内容使用之前调用 ，则读取器的行为可能与第一个内容的行为相同，然后调用 方法。If you call before all of the element content is consumed, the reader may behave as if the first content was consumed and then the method was called. 这意味着读取器将读取所有文本，直到遇到结束元素。This means that the reader will read all the text until the end element is encountered. 然后，它将读取结束标记节点，读取下一个节点，然后在下一个后续节点上定位自身。It will then read the end tag node, read the next node, and then position itself on the next subsequent node. 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例读取内联 `Base64` 编码的图像。The following example reads an inline `Base64` encoded image. `Base64` 数据嵌入 `` 元素中。The `Base64` data is embedded within the `` element. 用于创建新的二进制数据文件。A is used to create a new binary data file. summary.span: 读取当前元素并将内容作为 对象返回。

returns.span: 作为 对象的元素内容。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记和元素的内容，并将读取器移动到结束元素标记之后。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 它扩展实体并忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 如果元素内容类型 `xsd:boolean`，则读取器将返回取消装箱 对象。If the element content is typed `xsd:boolean`, the reader returns an unboxed object. 如果内容不是类型化的 `xsd:boolean`，则读取器将根据[W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议中定义的规则尝试将其转换为 的对象。If the content is not typed `xsd:boolean`, the reader attempts to convert it to a object according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 有关详细信息，请参阅 引用页的“备注”部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page.

span.span: The element content as a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记和元素的内容，并将读取器移动到结束元素标记之后。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 它扩展实体并忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 如果内容是类型 `xsd:dateTime`，则读取器将返回取消装箱 对象。If the content is typed `xsd:dateTime`, the reader returns an unboxed object. 如果内容不是类型化的 `xsd:dateTime`，则读取器将根据[W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议中定义的规则尝试将其转换为 的对象。If the content is not typed `xsd:dateTime`, the reader attempts to convert it to a object according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. > [!NOTE] > 如果内容类型化为 ，则不能使用 `xsd:gMonthDay` 值。You cannot rely on the value when the content is typed as `xsd:gMonthDay`. 在这种情况下 始终将 值设置为1904。 always sets the value to 1904 in this case. 有关详细信息，请参阅 引用页的“备注”部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法读取 `date` 元素的内容。The following example uses the method to read the content of the `date` element. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/CS/readElementContentAs.cs#4)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/VB/readElementContentAs.vb#4)] 示例使用 `dataFile.xml` 文件作为输入。The example uses the `dataFile.xml` file as input. [!code-xml[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#8](~/samples/snippets/xml/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/XML/dataFile.xml#8)]

summary.span: 读取当前元素并将内容作为 32 位有符号整数返回。

span.span: Reads the current element and returns the contents as a 32-bit signed integer.

returns.span: 作为 32 位有符号整数的元素内容。

span.span: The element content as a 32-bit signed integer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记和元素的内容，并将读取器移动到结束元素标记之后。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 它扩展实体并忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 如果内容是类型 `xsd:integer`，则读取器将返回取消装箱的32位有符号整数。If the content is typed `xsd:integer`, the reader returns an unboxed 32-bit signed integer. 如果内容不是类型化的 `xsd:integer`，则读取器将根据[W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议中定义的规则尝试将其转换为32位有符号整数。If the content is not typed `xsd:integer`, the reader attempts to convert it to a 32-bit signed integer according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 有关详细信息，请参阅 引用页的“备注”部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记和元素的内容，并将读取器移动到结束元素标记之后。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 它扩展实体并忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 如果内容是类型 `xsd:integer`，则读取器将返回取消装箱的32位有符号整数。If the content is typed `xsd:integer`, the reader returns an unboxed 32-bit signed integer. 如果内容不是类型化的 `xsd:integer`，则读取器将根据[W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议中定义的规则尝试将其转换为32位有符号整数。If the content is not typed `xsd:integer`, the reader attempts to convert it to a 32-bit signed integer according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 有关详细信息，请参阅 引用页的“备注”部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记和元素的内容，并将读取器移动到结束元素标记之后。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 它扩展实体并忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 如果内容是类型 `xsd:long`，则读取器将返回取消装箱的64位有符号整数。If the content is typed `xsd:long`, the reader returns an unboxed 64-bit signed integer. 如果内容不是类型化的 `xsd:long`，则读取器将根据[W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议中定义的规则尝试将其转换为64位有符号整数。If the content is not typed `xsd:long`, the reader attempts to convert it to a 64-bit signed integer according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 有关详细信息，请参阅 引用页的“备注”部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法读取 `longValue` 元素的内容。The following example uses the method to read the content of the `longValue` element. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记和元素的内容，并将读取器移动到结束元素标记之后。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 它扩展实体并忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 有关详细信息，请参阅 " 引用" 页和 " [W3C XML 架构第2部分：数据类型](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议" 的 "备注" 部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例读取 `stringValue` 元素并返回文本内容（忽略注释和处理指令）。The following example reads the `stringValue` element and returns the text content (ignoring the comment and processing instruction). [!code-csharp[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/CS/readElementContentAs.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/VB/readElementContentAs.vb#1)] 示例使用 `dataFile.xml` 文件作为输入。The example uses the `dataFile.xml` file as input. [!code-xml[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#8](~/samples/snippets/xml/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/XML/dataFile.xml#8)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回当前节点的所有内容，包括标记。This method returns all the content of the current node including the markup. 不返回当前节点（开始标记）和对应的结束节点（结束标记）。The current node (start tag) and corresponding end node (end tag) are not returned. 例如，如果你具有以下内容：For example, if you had the following: ```xml this ``` `ReadInnerXml` 返回 `this ``ReadInnerXml` returns `this ` 此方法按以下方式处理元素节点和属性节点：This method handles element and attribute nodes in the following manner: |节点类型Node type|调用之前的位置Position before the call|XML 片断XML fragment|返回值Return value|调用后的位置Position after the call| |---------------|------------------------------|------------------|------------------|-----------------------------| |`Element`|在 `item1` 开始标记上。On the `item1` start tag.|\ text1\\ 文本 2\\text1\\text2\|text1text1|在 `item2` 开始标记上。On the `item2` start tag.| |`Attribute`|在 `attr1` 属性节点上。On the `attr1` attribute node.|\<项 attr1 = "val1" attr2 = "val2" > 文本\\text\|val1val1|保留在 `attr1` 属性节点上。Remains on the `attr1` attribute node.| 如果读取器定位在叶节点上，则调用 `ReadInnerXml` 等效于调用 。If the reader is positioned on a leaf node, calling `ReadInnerXml` is equivalent to calling . 方法返回 `String.Empty` （属性节点除外，在这种情况下，将返回属性的值）。The method returns `String.Empty` (except for attribute nodes, in which case the value of the attribute is returned). 此方法检查格式正确的 XML。This method checks for well-formed XML. 如果从 调用 `ReadInnerXml`，此方法还会验证返回的内容。If `ReadInnerXml` is called from an , this method also validates the content returned. 在 中实现时， 和 `XmlValidatingReader` 类 `ReadOuterXml` 方法是识别命名空间的。As implemented in the , and `XmlValidatingReader` classes the `ReadOuterXml` method is namespace aware. 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例对 `ReadInnerXml` 和 方法进行比较。The following example compares the `ReadInnerXml` and methods. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#12)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#12)] 该示例使用 `2books.xml` 文件作为输入。The example uses `2books.xml` file as input. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法类似于 ，只不过它还返回开始标记和结束标记。This method is similar to except it also returns the start and end tags. 此方法按以下方式处理元素节点和属性节点：This method handles element and attribute nodes in the following manner: |节点类型Node type|调用之前的位置Position before the call|XML 片断XML fragment|返回值Return value|调用后的位置Position After the Call| |---------------|------------------------------|------------------|------------------|-----------------------------| |`Element`|在 `item1` 开始标记上。On the `item1` start tag.|\ text1\\ 文本 2\\text1\\text2\|\ text1\\text1\|在 `item2` 开始标记上。On the `item2` start tag.| |`Attribute`|在 `attr1` 属性节点上。On the `attr1` attribute node.|\<项 attr1 = "val1" attr2 = "val2" > 文本\\text\|attr1="val1"attr1="val1"|保留在 `attr1` 属性节点上。Remains on the `attr1` attribute node.| 如果读取器定位在叶节点上，则调用 `ReadOuterXml` 等效于调用 。If the reader is positioned on a leaf node, calling `ReadOuterXml` is equivalent to calling . 方法返回 `String.Empty` （属性节点除外，在这种情况下，将返回特性标记）。The method returns `String.Empty` (except for attribute nodes, in which case the attribute markup is returned). 此方法检查格式正确的 XML。This method checks for well-formed XML. 如果从 调用 `ReadOuterXml`，此方法还会验证返回的内容If `ReadOuterXml` is called from an , this method also validates the content returned 在 中实现时， 和 `XmlValidatingReader` 类 `ReadOuterXml` 方法是识别命名空间的。As implemented in the , and `XmlValidatingReader` classes the `ReadOuterXml` method is namespace aware. 给定以下 XML 文本 `hello`，如果读取器定位在 `S:B` 开始标记上，`ReadOuterXml` 将 `hello`返回。Given the following XML text `hello`, if the reader were positioned on the `S:B` start tag, `ReadOuterXml` returns `hello`. 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例对 `ReadInnerXml` 和 `ReadOuterXml` 方法进行比较。The following example compares the `ReadInnerXml` and `ReadOuterXml` methods. span.span: Calling the method positions the new reader on the node that was current before the call to the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 只能在元素节点上调用 。 can be called only on element nodes. 读取整个子树后，对 方法的调用将返回 `false`。When the entire sub-tree has been read, calls to the method returns `false`. 关闭新的 XML 读取器后，原始读取器将定位到子树的 "`EndElement`" 节点上。When the new XML reader has been closed, the original reader is positioned on the `EndElement` node of the sub-tree. 因此，如果您在 book 元素的开始标记上调用了 方法，则在读取子树并关闭新的 XML 读取器后，原始的 XML 读取器将定位到 book 元素的结束标记上。Thus, if you called the method on the start tag of the book element, after the sub-tree has been read and the new XML reader has been closed, the original XML reader is positioned on the end tag of the book element. 在关闭新的读取器之前，不应对原始读取器执行任何操作。You should not perform any operations on the original reader until the new reader has been closed. 不支持此操作，因为这样可能会导致意想不到的行为。This action is not supported and can result in unpredictable behavior. > [!NOTE] > 方法不用于创建可单独处理的 XML 数据副本。The method isn't intended for creating copies of the XML data that you can work with independently. 它旨在围绕 XML 元素创建边界。It's designed to create a boundary around an XML element. 如果要将数据传递给另一个组件进行处理，并且希望限制组件可以访问的数据量，则这非常有用。This is useful if you want to pass data to another component for processing and you wish to limit how much of your data the component can access. 将 方法返回的 XML 读取器传递到另一个应用程序时，应用程序只能访问该 XML 元素，而不能访问整个 XML 文档。When you pass an XML reader returned by the method to another application, the application can access only that XML element, not the entire XML document. ## Examples 下面的示例显示如何使用 方法。The following example shows how to use the method. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#13)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#13)] 使用以下 XML 数据运行本主题中的示例：Use the following XML data to run the examples in this topic: ```xml A Brief History of Time Principle Of Relativity Victory of Reason The Unicorn that did not Fail Rational Ontology The Meaning of Pizza ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法在功能上等效于从当前节点执行 `following::name` 的 XPath 表达式。This method is functionally equivalent executing the `following::name` XPath expression from the current node. 它提供了一种在 XML 文档中查找命名元素的快捷方法。It provides a quick way to find a named element in the XML document. 如果找到匹配的元素，它会使读取器前进到与指定名称匹配的下一个元素，并返回 `true`。It advances the reader to the next following element that matches the specified name and returns `true` if a matching element is found. 使用下面的示例，读取器将读取到指定元素的第一个实例，同时读取。Using the example below, the reader would read to the first instance of the specified element while reading forward. ```xml ``` ```csharp XmlTextReader reader = newXmlTextReader("sample.xml"); reader.ReadToFollowing("item"); ``` 可以在所有节点类型上调用此方法。This method can be called on all node types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法允许以流式处理的方式读取嵌入 XML 文档中的大量文本（即一次只需少量字符），而不是为整个值分配一个字符串。This method enables reading of very large streams of text embedded in an XML document in a streaming fashion, that is, a small number of characters at a time instead of allocating a single string for the whole value. 此方法可在任何具有值（ `true`）的节点上调用，但仅当在文本、空白和有效空白节点上调用时才会发生节点值的实际流式处理。This method can be called on any node that has a value ( is `true`), however actual streaming of the node value only occurs when called on a text, white space and significant white space nodes. 其他节点类型值缓存，包括属性和 CDATA 节点。Other node type values are cached, including attributes and CDATA nodes. 此方法只返回 属性的内容，而不移动 。This method returns only the content of the property and does not move the . 此方法将节点值的指定数量的字符（`count`）读入到指定偏移（`index`）的字符缓冲区（`buffer`），并返回写入缓冲区的字符数。This method reads the specified number of characters (`count`) of the node value into a character buffer (`buffer`) at a specified offset (`index`) and returns the number of characters written to the buffer. 它在到达值的末尾时返回 `0`。It returns the `0` when it has reached the end of the value. 它无法重新启动以再次读取该值。It cannot be restarted to read through the value again. 在对的两次调用之间 属性不会更改（ 属性除外）。In between calls to the properties do no change except for the property. 在访问 属性时，它可能会返回一个部分值（包含未由 返回的字符）或一个完整值（具体取决于实现）。When the property is accessed it may either return a partial value (with characters not yet returned by ) or a full value depending on the implementation. 命名空间中的所有 实现都返回 属性实现的部分值。All the implementations in the namespace return a partial value for the property implementation. 可以在对 的调用之间调用任何读取方法。Any Read method can be called in between calls to . 如果发生这种情况，则 会移动到流中的下一 ，而不会跳过任何尚未返回的字符。If this occurs, the moves to the next in the stream and any characters not yet returned are skipped. 如果 返回的字符数小于所请求的字符数，则可能会出现这种情况。There may be a case when returns less than the requested number of characters. 例如，如果你的长度为200个字符的长度为个字符的值，而代理项对位置127和128，且你使用128字符缓冲区调用了 ，则该方法调用将返回127字符，而不是请求的128。For example, if you had a 200-character long value with a surrogate pair at positions 127 and 128 and you called with a 128-character buffer, the method call would return 127 characters instead of the requested 128. 然后，将在下一个 调用中返回代理项对。The surrogate pair would then be returned in the next call. 在这种情况下， 不返回请求的128字符，这是因为这样做可能会导致缓冲区末尾的代理项对不完整。In this case, did not return the requested 128 characters because doing so would have resulted in an incomplete surrogate pair at the end of the buffer. 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在以下 XML 输入中，如果读取器定位在 `` 节点或它的任何属性上，则调用 `Skip` 会将读取器定位到 `` 节点。In the following XML input if the reader is positioned on the `` node or any of its attributes, calling `Skip` positions the reader to the `` node. 如果读取器定位在叶节点上（例如 `` 节点或文本节点 `abc`），则调用 `Skip` 与调用 时相同。If the reader is positioned on a leaf node already (such as the `` node or the text node `abc`), calling `Skip` is the same as calling . ```xml abc ... ``` 此方法检查格式正确的 XML。This method checks for well-formed XML. 如果读取器是 ，则此方法还会验证已跳过的内容。If the reader is an , this method also validates the skipped content. `XmlReader` 实现确定 `Skip` 方法是否将展开外部实体。The `XmlReader` implementation determines whether or not the `Skip` method will expand external entities. 下表描述了是否对各种类型的 `XmlReader` 对象展开外部实体。The following table describes whether the external entities are expanded for the various types of `XmlReader` objects. |XmlReader 的类型Type of XmlReader|展开外部实体Expands external entities| |-----------------------|-------------------------------| ||No。No.| |由读取文本数据的 方法创建 实例。 instance created by the method that is reading text data.|No。No.| |由读取二进制数据的 方法创建 实例。 instance created by the method that is reading binary data.|不适用。Not applicable.| |验证 方法创建 实例的架构。A schema validating instance created by the method.|可以。Yes.| ||可以。Yes.| | 由 对象返回的实例。 instance returned by a object.|不适用。Not applicable.| ||No。No.| |围绕另一个 实例 实例。 instance wrapped around another instance.|取决于基础 的实现。Depends on the implementation of the underlying . （调用基础 上的 `Skip` 方法）。(The `Skip` method on the underlying is called).| 有关此方法的异步版本，请参阅 。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例分析从第二个 book 节点开始的 XML 文件。The following example parses an XML file starting on the second book node. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#14)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#14)] 该示例使用文件（`2books.xml`）作为输入。The example uses the file, `2books.xml`, as input. remarks.format: ## Remarks 有关默认映射的列表，请参阅[System.web 类中的类型支持](/dotnet/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes)。See [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](/dotnet/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes) for a list of the default mappings. 默认情况下，类型 `xs:int` 的元素具有 `System.Int32` `ValueType`。An element of type `xs:int` has a `ValueType` of `System.Int32` by default. 但 `ValueType` 可以是可以映射到 `xs:int`的有效类型之一，如 `System.Int16` 或 `System.Double`。However, the `ValueType` could be one of the valid types that can be mapped to `xs:int`, such as `System.Int16` or `System.Double`. 如果节点未类型化，或者节点是包含混合内容的元素，则将节点值映射到 `System.String` 类型。If a node is un-typed, or if the node is an element that contains mixed content, the node value is mapped to the `System.String` type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性表示当前节点所在 `xml:lang` 范围。This property represents the `xml:lang` scope within which the current node resides. 例如，以下是根元素中 `xml:lang` 设置为 US 英语的 XML 片段：For example, here is an XML fragment with `xml:lang` set to US English in the root element: ```xml Fred ``` 当读取器定位在 `name` 元素上时，可以使用此属性来查找它是否在美国英语 `xml:lang` 属性的作用域中。When the reader is positioned on the `name` element, you can use this property to find that it is in the scope of a US English `xml:lang` attribute. ## Examples 有关使用此属性的示例，请参阅 。See for an example of using this property.
